DOC.brief_summary: This research study examine effectiveness brief , computerized motivational intervention plus treatment-as-usual treatment-as-usual alone treat alcohol misuse Veterans present primary care . The investigator aim recruit 162 Veterans screen positive AUDIT-C participate study . Participants randomly assign one two intervention condition ask complete baseline assessment two follow-up assessment conduct three six month post treatment . Baseline assessment conduct person train research assistant , follow-up interview conduct phone . The primary outcome clinical trial reduction number heavy drinking day . Several secondary outcome collect include health status , depressive symptom , consequence drinking , pain symptom , distress tolerance . The finding study may large scale implication alcohol misuse treat primary care . In addition , study provide evidence feasibility use computer method deliver evidence-based mental health intervention primary care .
DOC.brief_title: Implementing Evidence-Based Mental Health Practices Primary Care
